text: Psalm 65
Thanksgiving for God’s Provision

For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David. A song.\f + \fr Ps 65 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion,
and to you \add the\add* vow shall be fulfilled.
O \add you who\add* hear prayer,
to you all flesh will come.
Iniquities\f + \fr 65:3 \ft Hebrew “matters of iniquities” \f* prevail over me.
As for our transgressions, you will ⸤forgive⸥\f + \fr 65:3 \ft Literally “provide atonement for” \f* them.
Blessed \add is one whom\add* you choose and bring near,
\add that\add* he may abide in your courts.
We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house,
your holy temple.
By awesome deeds in righteousness you will answer us,
O God of our salvation,
\add you who are the\add* confidence \add of\add* all \add the\add* ends of \add the\add* earth
and \add of\add* the far-off seas,
\add who\add* established the mountains by his strength,
\add the one who\add* is girded with might,
\add who\add* stills \add the\add* roar of \add the\add* seas,
the roar of their waves,
and \add the\add* commotion of \add the\add* peoples,
so that\f + \fr 65:8 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add the\add* inhabitants of \add the\add* farthest reaches are in awe of your signs.
You make the dawn and sunset sing for joy.
You care for\f + \fr 65:9 \ft Or “visit” \f* the land\f + \fr 65:9 \ft Or “earth” \f* and water it;
you greatly enrich it.
The stream of God \add is\add* filled with waters.
You provide their grain,
for so you have established it.
You drench its furrows,
penetrating its ridges.
With rains you soften it;
its growth you bless.
You crown the year with your ⸤bounty⸥,\f + \fr 65:11 \ft Literally “goodness” \f*
and your wagon paths drip with ⸤richness⸥.\f + \fr 65:11 \ft Literally “fatness” \f*
They drop \add on the\add* pastures of \add the\add* wilderness,
and the hills gird themselves with joy.
\add The\add* pasturelands put on flocks,
and \add the\add* valleys clothe themselves with grain.
They shout in triumph;
they even sing.
